qas.question: For hydrogen what is the enthalpy of combustion?
What are two forms of hydrogen gas?
Which element has a enthalpy of combustion at −286 kJ/mol?

context: <a2_0>Hydrogen<a2_0/> gas (<a1_0>dihydrogen or molecular hydrogen<a1_0/>) is highly flammable and will burn in air at a very wide range of concentrations between 4% and 75% by volume. The enthalpy of combustion for hydrogen is −<a0_0>286 kJ/mol<a0_0/>:
